data.question_eng: The primary role of the data bus in a computer system is:

options.a: CPU और मुख्य मेमोरी के बीच डेटा ट्रांसफर करना।
options.b: घटकों के बीच नियंत्रण सिग्नल्स का संचार करना।
options.c: CPU और मुख्य मेमोरी के बीच पत्ते का ट्रांसफर करना।
options.d: मेमोरी में डेटा के अंदर और बाहर के प्रवाह को प्रबंधित करना।

options_eng.a: Transferring data between CPU and main memory.
options_eng.c: Transferring data between CPU and main memory.
options_eng.d: Managing the flow of data in and out of memory.

data.question:
निम्नलिखित का मिलान कीजिए-
टर्मिनल टाईप - विवरण
(A) इंटेलिजेंट टर्मिनल (1) इनपुट/आउटपुट के लिए मुख्य कम्प्यूटर से जुड़े हुए, डेटा को प्रोसेस नहीं कर सकता
(B) डम्ब टर्मिनल (2) अपनी मेमोरी, प्रोसेसर और फर्मवेयर के साथ एक व्यक्तिगत कम्प्यूटर
(C) सामान्य प्रयोजन टर्मिनल (3) विशिष्ट कार्यों के लिए डिजाइन किया गया, जैसे- एयरलाइन आरक्षण या अस्पताल की निगरानी (मॉनिटरिंग)
(D) कार्य-विशिष्ट टर्मिनल (4) सामान्य अनुप्रयोगों के लिए उपयोग किया जाता है, जैसे - इंटरनेट ब्राउजिंग जिसमें स्थानीय डेटा प्रोसेसिंग क्षमता होती है
कूटः-
A B C D
data.question_eng:
Match the following:
Terminal Type - Description
(A) Intelligent terminal (1) Connected to the main computer for input/output, cannot process data
(B) Dumb terminal (2) A personal computer with its own memory, processor, and firmware
(C) General-purpose terminal (3) Designed for specific tasks, such as airline reservations or hospital monitoring
(D) Task-specific terminal (4) Used for general applications, such as Internet browsing, with local data processing capability
Code:-
A B C D

data.question:

options.c: ग्रेड 3 में गणित में छात्रों का प्रदर्शन 66% रहा।
options.d: ग्रेड 9 में भाषा में छात्रों का प्रदर्शन 54% रहा।

options_eng.a: Students' performance in language in Grade 3 was 70%.

options_eng.c: Students' performance in mathematics in Grade 3 was 66%.
options_eng.d: Students' performance in language in Grade 9 was 54%.

data.question:
Change the narration of the sentence given below.
He said that he would rather go hungry than beg.

options.a: He said, “I prefer going hungry than begging.”
options.b: He said, “I should rather go hungry than beg.”
options.c: He said, “I would rather go hungry than beg.”
options.d: He said, “I had rather gone hungry than begged.”

data.question:
Change the narration of the sentence given below.
She wished that she had not told him the truth.

options.a: She said, “I wish I would not tell him the truth.”
options.b: She said, “I wished I had not told him the truth.”
options.c: He said, “I wish I didn’t tell him the truth.”
options.d: She said, “I wish I had not told him the truth.”

data.question:
Change the narration of the sentence given below.
He exclaimed with sorrow that his friend had betrayed him.

options.a: He said, “My friend has betrayed me!”
options.b: He said, “Alas! My friend has betrayed me!”
options.c: He said, “Oh, my friend betrayed me.”
options.d: He said, “Alas, his friend betrays him.”

data.question:
Someone has to clean the classroom every day.
Choose the correct passive form

options.a: The classroom has to be cleaned every day.
options.b: The classroom must be cleaned every day.
options.c: The classroom is cleaned every day.
options.d: The classroom was to be cleaned every day.

data.question:
They are going to build a new bridge here.
Choose the correct passive form

options.a: A new bridge is going to be built here.
options.b: A new bridge is built here.
options.c: A new bridge has been built here.
options.d: A new bridge was being built here.

data.question:
They made him confess the truth.
Choose the correct passive form.

options.a: He was made confess the truth.
options.b: He was to be made confess the truth.
options.c: He was made to confess the truth.
options.d: He has been to made confess the truth.

data.question: Choose the one word for – Something which is easily broken into pieces.
Which of the following is not true of Bilingual method of teaching second language?

options.a: The Bilingual Method is grounded in cognitive code-learning principles.
options.b: It distinguishes between meaning explanation and practice medium.
options.c: It treats the native language as redundant interference.
options.d: In the Bilingual Method, the L1 explanation occurs after L2 presentation.

data.question: Which of the following is not true of Grammar Translation Method of teaching second language?

options.a: GTM learners often translate literally, leading to interference errors.
options.b: It neglects discourse competence and situational meaning.
options.c: It assumes language learning equals rule memorization.

data.question: Which of the following is not true of Direct method?

options.a: Direct Method stresses habit formation through substitution drills.
options.b: It views error correction as an immediate, oral process.
options.c: It promotes implicit grammar awareness through repeated exposure.
options.d: The teacher’s role is largely that of model and stimulator.

data.question: A teacher begins a new topic in English by first recalling the related previous lesson. This practice illustrates–

options.c: Principle of linking with previous knowledge

data.question: The principle of following the natural order suggests that–

options.c: Primary skills should be developed before secondary skills.
options.d: Grammar translation should be the first step.

data.question: The principle of equal proportion in language teaching advocates that–

options.a: All four skills – listening, speaking, reading, writing – should develop together.
options.b: Grammar should be taught more than communication.
options.c: Speaking should be ignored at early stages.

data.question: “Language learning becomes meaningful when the new is built upon the known.” This reflects—

options.b: Principle of Linking to the pre-knowledge.

data.question: A teacher gives students praise after every correct answer to strengthen their confidence. This method demonstrates–
In Remedial Teaching, “reinforcement” is essential because it –

options.a: Strengthens correct responses through guided practice
options.b: Repeats errors to make them memorable

data.question: Which evaluation method gives immediate feedback for improving teaching-learning?
The most suitable method of evaluating speaking skills in CLT is —

options.b: Structured interview and pair interaction tasks

data.question: Remedial teaching differs from regular teaching because it –

options.a: Is conducted only for bright students
options.c: Aims to diagnose and remove specific learning difficulties
options.d: Focuses on new content rather than correction

data.question: In CLT, “fluency” is best defined as –

options.a: The ability to use correct grammar all the time
options.b: The ability to produce language smoothly and spontaneously
options.c: The memorization of dialogues and patterns
